article.title: circuit breaker
article.p:
circuit breaker
, automatic switch in an
electric circuit
. Its function is similar to that of a
fuse
—to open the circuit if abnormal current conditions occur, usually overloads—but it is not destroyed in operation and can be closed again. The simplest circuit breakers are operated by a
solenoid
that is activated by an excessive increase in current flow. Small circuit breakers are widely used in place of fuses to protect electrical systems in homes.
